atten4.ptxt: Compared to normal mode, check mode has a better ability to detect malfunctions. Furthermore, the same diagnostic items which are detected in normal mode can also be detected in check mode.

step2.ptxt: Make sure that the following conditions are met.

step3.ptxt: Shift lever on P or N.

step2.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the intelligent tester ON.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / Check Mode.
Make sure the MIL flashes as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: All the recorded DTCs and freeze frame data will be erased if: 1) the intelligent tester is used to change the ECM from normal mode to check mode or vice versa; or 2) during check mode, the ignition switch is turned from ON to ACC or OFF.

step2.ptxt: Start the engine (the MIL should turn OFF).
Simulate the condition of the malfunction described by the customer.
After simulating the malfunction condition, check the DTCs, freeze frame data and other data.
After checking the DTCs, inspect the applicable circuits.
